headline: France records more deaths than births in 2025, a first since World War II
subhead: The country recorded 645,000 births and 651,000 deaths in 2025. This shift stemmed from declining fertility and rising mortality in the large baby boomer generation, according to France's annual national demographic report.

headline: Trump warns of 'very strong action' if Iran follows through with threats of hanging protestors
France slightly improves reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, but remains far from target
Javier Milei's budget cuts criticized after Patagonia fires
subhead: In just eight days, nearly 15,000 hectares of land on southern Argentina have been destroyed by flames, including 12,000 in Chubut Province. Environmental advocacy groups have condemned drastic budget cuts to the Federal Fire Management System.

headline: 'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
subhead: The seven major tech companies are both the newest and the most profitable businesses in the United States, embodying the capitalist energy of the American dream, writes Le Monde's Arnaud Leparmentier in his column.

headline: 'Nobel Prize for Environment' awarded to specialist in invisible, fascinating and vital mycorrhizal fungi
subhead: Toby Kiers, an American mycologist and evolutionary biologist, is working on all fronts to raise awareness about the importance of plant-fungi interactions and the urgent need to protect this biodiversity.

headline: Cécile Pelaudeix, Ph.D. in political science: 'With Greenland, Trump is seeking a territorial trophy for his personal legacy'
subhead: The threats facing Greenland are testing the European Union, writes the Arctic specialist, who argues the EU must establish regular strategic dialogue with Greenland and Denmark and have the courage to rethink its relationship with the United States.

headline: Claudette Colvin, US civil rights pioneer, has died at 86
Olympic legends join together to promote official ticket registration for 2028 Games in Los Angeles
US prices remain high, despite Trump's claims of stable inflation
US Supreme Court seems poised to uphold transgender athlete bans
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
When the US and Venezuela were 'best friends': A four-minute history
US labels Muslim Brotherhood groups in Egypt, Lebanon and Jordan terrorist organizations
'West Wing' actor Timothy Busfield turns himself in, vows to fight child sex abuse charges in New Mexico
Iranian regime rallies supporters in bid to quell unrest
Moroccan King Mohammed VI's quiet absence from AFCON
Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminals' grip on island
Clintons refuse to testify in US House Epstein investigation as Republicans threaten contempt proceedings
Iran internet blackout: 'The authorities have managed to control the almost sole way out'
subhead: Iran's near-total disconnection from the internet can be explained by a strategy of closely controlling the only gateway for data to enter and leave the country, which the Iranian authorities have pursued for several years.

headline: Marine Le Pen returns to court for appeal of graft conviction
subhead: The French far right's leader, sentenced in 2025 to four years in prison and a five-year ban on holding an elected office after being convicted of embezzlement of pubic funds, goes back to court with 11 co-defendants for a one-month trial starting Tuesday.

headline: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

headline: France's population decline presents a political challenge
'The trial of Marine Le Pen exposes the fragility of the concept of the rule of law'
Quinn Slobodian: 'The US discarding the post-1945 international system is a bold and reckless gamble'
